recipe.ingredients: - chicken breast (skinless and boneless): 2 pieces (approximately 6 ounces each) - lemon juice: 3 tablespoons - olive oil: 2 tablespoons - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - dried oregano: 1 teaspoon - dried basil: 1 teaspoon - mixed salad greens: 4 cups - cherry tomatoes (halved): 1 cup - cucumber (sliced): 1 medium - red onion (thinly sliced): 1 small - feta cheese (crumbled, optional): 1/4 cup - black olives (sliced, optional): 1/4 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Marinade: In a small bowl, combine lemon juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, minced garlic, oregano, and basil. Whisk them together thoroughly. 2. Marinate Chicken: Place chicken breasts in a shallow dish or a resealable plastic bag. Pour the marinade over the chicken, ensuring it is well-coated. Refrigerate and let marinate for at least 1 hour, preferably longer. 3. Grill Chicken: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Remove chicken from the marinade, letting excess drip off. Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side or until fully cooked and juices run clear. Remove from grill and let rest for a few minutes before slicing. 4. Assemble Salad: In a large salad bowl, toss together mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, feta cheese, and black olives. Drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. 5. Serve: Slice grilled chicken and place on top of the salad. Serve immediately for the best flavor.
